head.citation-title: Silk proteins for wound healing materials
head.abstracts: Silk materials have been shown to promote wound healing since the 1990s. Both sericin and fibroin have been found to be an effective substrate for the proliferation of adherent animal cells and can be used as a substitute for collagen. Because of their excellent physical and biological properties, silk sericin and fibroin were widely investigated for their use in biomedical applications including wound healing materials. © 2012 by Nova Science Publishers, Inc. All rights reserved.

copyright.$: Copyright 2014 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

coredata.dc:description: Silk materials have been shown to promote wound healing since the 1990s. Both sericin and fibroin have been found to be an effective substrate for the proliferation of adherent animal cells and can be used as a substitute for collagen. Because of their excellent physical and biological properties, silk sericin and fibroin were widely investigated for their use in biomedical applications including wound healing materials. © 2012 by Nova Science Publishers, Inc. All rights reserved.
coredata.dc:title: Silk proteins for wound healing materials
